intro: Pilosella praemorsiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. It features silver-gray foliage due to dense pubescence, and its flowers are usually yellow with a central disc. Pilosella praemorsiformis is often found in open habitats and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
